discussion.content:
Correct answer is E
Mobile and remote access
Cisco Unified Communications mobile and remote access is a core part of the Cisco Collaboration Edge
Architecture. It allows endpoints such as Cisco Jabber to have their registration, call control, provisioning,
messaging and presence services provided by Cisco Unified Communications Manager (Unified CM) when
the endpoint is not within the enterprise network.

Shouldn't this be answer
E. Cisco Mobile and Remote Access
???

questions.question_text: Which component allows Cisco Jabber to communicate with Cisco Jabber clients who are outside the corporate network?
What are three ways for an administrator to create users in Cisco Unity Connection? (Choose three.)

choices.C: Import from a Microsoft Word document
choices.D: Import from an Adobe PDF document
choices.F: Import from a Microsoft Outlook contacts list G. import from LDAP
choices.B: Import from Cisco Unified Communications Manager Express

discussion.content: The Answer should be A, E, and G.

questions.question_text: Which two user attributes can be defined in Cisco Unity Connection before the users can be added? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: The answer is D and E.

questions.question_text: A user presses the envelope button on a 7945 IP phone, but it only launches audio voicemail. Where should the voice systems administrator troubleshoot?

discussion.content: C. SIP trunk between Cisco Unified Communications Manager and Unity Connection

choices.B: Visual voicemail IP phone service in Cisco Unified Communications Manager
choices.A: Visual voicemail IP phone service in Cisco Unity Connection
choices.C: SIP trunk between Cisco Unified Communications Manager and Unity Connection

discussion.content: You can unlock the PIN or select "User Must Change at Next Sign-In" in Password Settings. Maybe that's what they mean? To change the PIN, Change Password menu.

Following the referenced guide, looking at page A-4 (p.274) you can see that if the system is integrated with LDAP the web application password is controlled by the LDAP server.
So the answer is (maybe) D.
Follow the guide provided in link, answer A is correct

I believe the answer should be:
C. Change Password

The reasoning for this is because in the Password Settings menu, there is no place to for a PIN change. You can select "User must change at next sign-in" but that doesn't help if the user forgot their PIN.

questions.question_text: An engineer needs to reset a user PIN in CISCO Unity Connection where LDAP user synchronization is occurring. To which menu option in the user account must they navigate to accomplish this reset?
